title: Medina (duo)
text:
Medina is a <a href="Sweden">Swedish</a> <a href="hip%20hop">hip hop</a> and <a href="rap">rap</a> duo formation with Arabic influences made up of Swedish artists of <a href="Tunisia">Tunisia</a>n descent, being Sam-E (real name Sami Daniel Rekik), a former professional <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player in Tunisia and Alibi (real name Ali Jammali). Sam-E is also of <a href="Finns">Finnish</a> descent as his mother is Finnish. The two started making music in 2003 under the name Medina after they met in <a href="Knivsta">Knivsta</a> promoting a special genre they called "Haffla music" with rhythm from the <a href="Arab%20World">Arab World</a> mixed with hip hop.
Their debut release was mixtape/album "Rumble in Fiskayyet" and the resulting single "Magdansös". They followed up with a series of albums, "Fullblod", "7 dar", "Mosh Normal", "Hayat" and "Sista Minuten". Their single "Miss Decibel" from the album "Sista Minuten" reached number 2 on <a href="Sverigetopplistan">Sverigetopplistan</a>, the official Swedish Singles Chart. They have also released series of 4 mixtapes under the title "Varsågod de e gratis" and two volumes in the series "Haffla Music".
Sami Rekik of the duo has taken part in <a href="Melodifestivalen%202021">Melodifestivalen 2021</a> in collaboration with <a href="Christopher%20Wahlberg">WAHL</a> in the song "90-talet". Jammali is reportedly joining him back to take part in <a href="Melodifestivalen%202022">Melodifestivalen 2022</a>.
Solo projects.
Ali Jammali.
Ali Jammali collaborated with G Mansour co-writing 10 of the rappers 16-track album "The Cage". He alsor recorded and produced the track alongside Sami Rekik in the Medina Studios.
Sami Rekik.
Sam-E has released his own solo releases including the album "Om ni ba Wuisste" and collaborated with other artists including with OIAM in "Avundsjuka", a charting hit on <a href="Sverigetopplistan">Sverigetopplistan</a>. He has also collaborated with <a href="S%C3%B6draSidan">SödraSidan</a>, Alpis, Petter, <a href="Anis%20Don%20Demina">Anis Don Demina</a>, <a href="Elias%20Abbas">Elias Abbas</a> and many others.
In 2021, Sami Rekik under the mononym SAMI took part in <a href="Melodifestivalen%202021">Melodifestivalen 2021</a> with the song "90-talet" alongside member of duo SödraSidan <a href="Christopher%20Wahlberg">Christopher Wahlberg</a> under the stage name WAHL. The duo performed their song on 13 February 2021 during the second semi-final of the qualification round for <a href="Eurovision%20Song%20Contest">Eurovision Song Contest</a> for representing Sweden in Eurovision. WAHL featuring SAMI, the song came 6th of 7 acts during the night failing to qualify to the final or the Second Chance. However their song has charted in <a href="Sverigetopplistan">Sverigetopplistan</a>, the official Swedish Singles Chart.
